metadata.title: CVE-2021-46944 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: media:staging/intel-ipu3: Fix memory leak in imu_fmt We are losing the referenceto an allocated memory if try. Change the order of the check to avoid that.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46944` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-77-generic - 5.4.0-77.86
linux-image-5.4.0-77-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-77.86
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-77-generic - 5.4.0-77.86
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-77-lowlatency - 5.4.0-77.86
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-33-generic - 5.15.0-33.34~20.04.1
